headline.print_headline: White House Opposes House's $570B Defense Bill
headline.main: White House Opposes House's $570B Defense Bill

docs.snippet: The White House is objecting to the House's $570 billion defense spending bill, complaining about congressional restrictions on handling detainees at the U.S. prison at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, and obstacles to Pentagon cost-saving moves....
docs.lead_paragraph: The White House is objecting to the House's $570 billion defense spending bill, complaining about congressional restrictions on handling detainees at the U.S. prison at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, and obstacles to Pentagon cost-saving moves.

headline.print_headline: First Black, Openly Gay Man Confirmed as U.S. Federal Judge
headline.main: First Black, Openly Gay Man Confirmed as U.S. Federal Judge

docs.snippet: The United States' first black, openly gay male judge was appointed to the federal bench on Tuesday in a unanimous confirmation decision by the U.S. Senate....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States' first black, openly gay male judge was appointed to the federal bench on Tuesday in a unanimous confirmation decision by the U.S. Senate.

headline.print_headline: Failed Bitcoin Exchange Mt Gox Gets U.S. Bankruptcy Protection
headline.main: Failed Bitcoin Exchange Mt Gox Gets U.S. Bankruptcy Protection

docs.snippet: The failed Tokyo-based bitcoin exchange, Mt Gox, received court approval on Tuesday to begin Chapter 15 bankruptcy proceedings in the United States as it awaits approval of a settlement with U.S. customers and a sale of its business....
docs.lead_paragraph: The failed Tokyo-based bitcoin exchange, Mt Gox, received court approval on Tuesday to begin Chapter 15 bankruptcy proceedings in the United States as it awaits approval of a settlement with U.S. customers and a sale of its business.

headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Top Bank of America Financial Companies Banker Leaves for Oaktree-Sources

docs.lead_paragraph: William Egan, a Bank of America Merrill Lynch top investment banker for financial institutions, has resigned to join credit investment and private equity firm Oaktree Capital Group LLC, according to people familiar with the matter.

headline.print_headline: Liberia Convicts 13 for Killing Peacekeepers in Ivorian Raids
headline.main: Liberia Convicts 13 for Killing Peacekeepers in Ivorian Raids

docs.snippet: A Liberian court on Tuesday sentenced 13 people to life imprisonment for cross-border raids into Ivory Coast that killed seven U.N. peacekeepers in a controversial case....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Liberian court on Tuesday sentenced 13 people to life imprisonment for cross-border raids into Ivory Coast that killed seven U.N. peacekeepers in a controversial case.

headline.print_headline: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared Tuesday
headline.main: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared Tuesday

docs.snippet: U.S. stocks ended slightly higher as investors bid up banks and other financial companies. News that U.S. consumer prices jumped sharply in May drove up long-term interest rates, setting the stage for the turnaround as investors bought E-Trade Fin...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. stocks ended slightly higher as investors bid up banks and other financial companies. News that U.S. consumer prices jumped sharply in May drove up long-term interest rates, setting the stage for the turnaround as investors bought E-Trade Financial, Charles Schwab, Goldman Sachs and other stocks.
